channel.title: 317 packet documentation
channel.description:
The one Yz85racer posted got deleted along with his list of packets, so I thought I'd make a new one. Here are the packets I have documented in numerical order:
serverside: Packet 0: ping timeout packet Packet 3: sent when the client changes focus Packet 4: public chat, sent when a player says something Packet 14: use an item on a player Packet 16: an alternate item option, like clicking teleport on a glory, for example Packet 17: click second NPC option Packet 18: click fourth NPC option Packet 21: click third NPC option Packet 25: use item on ground item Packet 35: use magic on an object Packet 41: equip item packet Packet 43: bank 10 items/sell 5 items Packet 53: use item on item Packet 57: use item on NPC Packet 60: type a name into enter name interface (this is shown when the client receives packet 187) Packet 70: the third object clicking packet Packet 72: attack NPC Packet 73: attack a player Packet 74: remove from ignore list Packet 75: another alternate item option Packet 86: sent when the camera angle changes Packet 87: drop item packet Packet 95: update public chat, trade/duel, and private chat (on, off, friend and for public chat hide) Packet 101: update appearance changes on character design screen Packet 103: command packet, sent when user executes a :: command Packet 117: bank 5 items/sell 1 item Packet 120: sent when a flashing sidebar tab is clicked (the packet to make the tab flash is 24, and writeByteA is used to write the ID of the tab, which must be 0 to 13 or 0 to 12, I don't know if it counts the blank tab) Packet 121: sent when changing map region Packet 122: sent when using an using an item such as food or bones, which have a unique first click option (bandages would be another example) Packet 126: send a private message Packet 128: click first player option Packet 129: bank all items/buy 10 items Packet 130: sent when clicking some buttons in game, like report abuse, for example Packet 131: use magic on an NPC Packet 132: the first object clicking packet Packet 133: add to ignore list Packet 135: bank x items Packet 139: accept trade Packet 145: remove item packet Packet 153: click second player option Packet 155: click first NPC option Packet 181: use magic on ground item Packet 185: sent when clicking most buttons Packet 188: add friend Packet 192: use item on object Packet 202: idle logout packet Packet 208: type an amount into enter amount interface (this is shown when the client receives packet 27) Packet 210: sent when changing map region Packet 214: sent when player swaps position of items in inventory Packet 215: remove friend Packet 218: report a player Packet 228: the fifth object clicking packet Packet 234: the fourth object clicking packet Packet 236: pick an item up off the ground Packet 237: use magic on an item Packet 241: clicking packet Packet 249: use magic on a player Packet 252: the second object clicking packet Packet 253: alternate option for clicking item on ground, like lighting a log, for example ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- clientside: Packet 24: makes a sidebar tab flash Packet 27: shows enter amount interface Packet 34: write items to inventory Packet 35: shakes the camera, looks like an earthquake Packet 36: adjusts the volume Packet 50: updates a friend's online status and world in friends list Packet 68: resets game options and player controls to their original positions Packet 71: set the interface ID of a sidebar tab Packet 74: looks like it plays music Packet 78: makes the flag on the mini-map disappear Packet 87: adjusts the volume Packet 97: shows an interface Packet 99: makes the mini-map black and unclickable (the recieved value is meant to be 0 to reset it to normal or 2 to make it black, but anything other than 0 or 2 will only make it unclickable) Packet 104: creates an option in the right click player menu Packet 106: changes selected sidebar tab Packet 107: resets the boolean array in packet 35, stopping the earthquake Packet 109: logs client out Packet 114: system update Packet 121: also looks like it plays music, but it's different than packet 74 Packet 126: "sendquest" Packet 134: get the level and experience to the next level of a skill Packet 142: shows an interface over your inventory and removes the sidebar icons Packet 164: shows an interface over that chat box Packet 166: changes the camera view Packet 176: sets the information in the welcome screen and opens it Packet 177: changes the camera view Packet 187: shows enter name interface Packet 196: displays a private message Packet 206: sets public chat, trade/duel, and private chat depending on the recieved data Packet 208: shows an interface normally, but you can't interact with it and you can still walk Packet 214: replace all the names on the ignore list with the one received by the client Packet 218: shows an interface over the chat box, additionally, any sendMessage text will be displayed over the chat with the click to continue interface Packet 219: closes all interfaces Packet 221: friends/ignore list loading status (0, 1, 2 and 3 are the options, but everything above 3 will display the same message as 3 does) Packet 248: shows an interface on the game screen as well as on your inventory Packet 253: sendMessage (also handles trade and duel requests depending on whether the recieved String ends with :duelreq: :tradereq: or :chalreq:) I haven't tested chalreq
Feel free to post packets that are not included in this list and correct errors.

item.title: 317 packet documentation
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“IP, post:9, topic:219205”]Thanks for this :).

I’m sure many people needed this. I’m not sure if you added it, if its up there, but I’m sure many people could use with the missing packet in most client, which has the ability for the player to talk to the NPC?

I’m sure many people would be grateful if it was up there, or if you added it.

Thanks though.

  • Matt.[/quote]
    Lol,
    The people here don’t even know what a packet is.
    Let alone how to use them for their correct purposes.
    Oh well.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 packet documentation
item.dc:creator: @Not_Pwnd Not Pwnd
item.description:
@Not_Pwnd wrote:

It’s a list of ‘case’ ID’s that tell what each case is Supposed to do. So if you see packet 14: it means case 14: item on player. There you’d enter your code of things such as christmas crackers on another player.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 packet documentation
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

The one Yz85racer posted got deleted along with his list of packets, so I thought I’d make a new one.
Here are the packets I have documented in numerical order:

serverside:
Packet 0: ping timeout packet
Packet 3: sent when the client changes focus
Packet 4: public chat, sent when a player says something
Packet 14: use an item on a player
Packet 16: an alternate item option, like clicking teleport on a glory, for example
Packet 17: click second NPC option
Packet 18: click fourth NPC option
Packet 21: click third NPC option
Packet 25: use item on ground item
Packet 35: use magic on an object
Packet 41: equip item packet
Packet 43: bank 10 items/sell 5 items
Packet 53: use item on item
Packet 57: use item on NPC
Packet 60: type a name into enter name interface (this is shown when the client receives packet 187)
Packet 70: the third object clicking packet
Packet 72: attack NPC
Packet 73: attack a player
Packet 74: remove from ignore list
Packet 75: another alternate item option
Packet 86: sent when the camera angle changes
Packet 87: drop item packet
Packet 95: update public chat, trade/duel, and private chat (on, off, friend and for public chat hide)
Packet 101: update appearance changes on character design screen
Packet 103: command packet, sent when user executes a :: command
Packet 117: bank 5 items/sell 1 item
Packet 120: sent when a flashing sidebar tab is clicked (the packet to make the tab flash is 24, and writeByteA is used to write the ID of the tab, which must be 0 to 13 or 0 to 12, I don’t know if it counts the blank tab)
Packet 121: sent when changing map region
Packet 122: sent when using an using an item such as food or bones, which have a unique first click option (bandages would be another example)
Packet 126: send a private message
Packet 128: click first player option
Packet 129: bank all items/buy 10 items
Packet 130: sent when clicking some buttons in game, like report abuse, for example
Packet 131: use magic on an NPC
Packet 132: the first object clicking packet
Packet 133: add to ignore list
Packet 135: bank x items
Packet 139: accept trade
Packet 145: remove item packet
Packet 153: click second player option
Packet 155: click first NPC option
Packet 181: use magic on ground item
Packet 185: sent when clicking most buttons
Packet 188: add friend
Packet 192: use item on object
Packet 202: idle logout packet
Packet 208: type an amount into enter amount interface (this is shown when the client receives packet 27)
Packet 210: sent when changing map region
Packet 214: sent when player swaps position of items in inventory
Packet 215: remove friend
Packet 218: report a player
Packet 228: the fifth object clicking packet
Packet 234: the fourth object clicking packet
Packet 236: pick an item up off the ground
Packet 237: use magic on an item
Packet 241: clicking packet
Packet 249: use magic on a player
Packet 252: the second object clicking packet
Packet 253: alternate option for clicking item on ground, like lighting a log, for example

clientside:
Packet 24: makes a sidebar tab flash
Packet 27: shows enter amount interface
Packet 34: write items to inventory
Packet 35: shakes the camera, looks like an earthquake
Packet 36: adjusts the volume
Packet 50: updates a friend’s online status and world in friends list
Packet 68: resets game options and player controls to their original positions
Packet 71: set the interface ID of a sidebar tab
Packet 74: looks like it plays music
Packet 78: makes the flag on the mini-map disappear
Packet 87: adjusts the volume
Packet 97: shows an interface
Packet 99: makes the mini-map black and unclickable (the recieved value is meant to be 0 to reset it to normal or 2 to make it black, but anything other than 0 or 2 will only make it unclickable)
Packet 104: creates an option in the right click player menu
Packet 106: changes selected sidebar tab
Packet 107: resets the boolean array in packet 35, stopping the earthquake
Packet 109: logs client out
Packet 114: system update
Packet 121: also looks like it plays music, but it’s different than packet 74
Packet 126: “sendquest”
Packet 134: get the level and experience to the next level of a skill
Packet 142: shows an interface over your inventory and removes the sidebar icons
Packet 164: shows an interface over that chat box
Packet 166: changes the camera view
Packet 176: sets the information in the welcome screen and opens it
Packet 177: changes the camera view
Packet 187: shows enter name interface
Packet 196: displays a private message
Packet 206: sets public chat, trade/duel, and private chat depending on the recieved data
Packet 208: shows an interface normally, but you can’t interact with it and you can still walk
Packet 214: replace all the names on the ignore list with the one received by the client
Packet 218: shows an interface over the chat box, additionally, any sendMessage text will be displayed over the chat with the click to continue interface
Packet 219: closes all interfaces
Packet 221: friends/ignore list loading status (0, 1, 2 and 3 are the options, but everything above 3 will display the same message as 3 does)
Packet 248: shows an interface on the game screen as well as on your inventory
Packet 253: sendMessage (also handles trade and duel requests depending on whether the recieved String ends with :duelreq: :tradereq: or :chalreq:) I haven’t tested chalreq

Feel free to post packets that are not included in this list and correct errors.

Read full topic
